[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: IMS provides real-time inventory tracking, automated stock adjustments, and formula-based management for supply chain efficiency.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Inventory Management System (IMS) defines requirements to automate stock tracking, quantity adjustments, and compliance reporting.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: IMS integrates with accounting, POS, and inventory control systems for synchronized stock levels and financial accuracy.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: IMS provides a React.js-based UI with Material UI, supporting dashboards and role-based access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: IMS operates on corporate cloud infrastructure with scalable resources.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: IMS automates backup, restoration, and integrates external systems via FastAPI.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: IMS ensures secure transactions using REST APIs with TLS 1.3 and AES-256 encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: IMS optimizes concurrent transactions for high availability.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: IMS supports a minimum of six concurrent users for inventory transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: IMS allows user roles, dashboards, and security policy configurations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: IMS connects to financial reporting, compliance, and supply chain analytics.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: IMS facilitates inventory tracking, automated stock adjustments, formula-based substitutions, and compliance audits.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: IMS requires stable cloud connectivity, database authentication, and adherence to security protocols.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: IMS is designed for inventory managers, finance teams, and operations staff.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: IMS relies on integrated accounting, supply chain, and compliance systems.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with accounting software, POS terminals, and logistics APIs for real-time stock updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall generate Inventory Adjustment reports, including retrospective calculations (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall modify product formulas, manage stock substitutions, and ensure production continuity.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall generate Inventory Adjustment reports within 30 minutes (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support a minimum of six simultaneous users.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive React.js UI with role-based dashboards for inventory management.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support structured navigation with customizable access controls.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall operate on corporate cloud infrastructure without additional licensing costs.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall support automated backups and on-demand data restoration.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall use PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Redis for data processing (REQ-FUNC-001, REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with financial auditing standards and regulatory compliance policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall monitor uptime, performance, and security while enabling automated backups.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Validates inventory, stock substitutions, and IQA automation.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Compliance, security, and API best practices.
[SEC] 5. References: Standards for inventory, cloud security, and compliance.
